landscapetools 0.4.0

util_rescale

util_rescale.Rd

Linearly rescale element values in a raster to a range between 0 and 1.

util_rescale(x)

Arguments

x

Raster* object

Value

Raster* object with values ranging from 0-1

Details

Rasters generated by nlm_ functions are scaled between 0 and 1 as default, this option can be set to FALSE if needed.

Examples

unscmap <- util_merge(grdmap, rndmap, rescale = FALSE)
util_rescale(unscmap)
#> class       : RasterLayer 
#> dimensions  : 150, 150, 22500  (nrow, ncol, ncell)
#> resolution  : 1, 1  (x, y)
#> extent      : 0, 150, 0, 150  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)
#> coord. ref. : NA 
#> data source : in memory
#> names       : layer 
#> values      : 0, 1  (min, max)
#>
